channel.title: Help please
channel.description:
Ok i have decompiled a .jar file into .java files anyway i make the alterations i wish to make however when i go to recompile i get 100 errors :\ *Posted below*. I dont know why so if anyone knows it'd be a great help.
Thanks.
[code] ^ help.java:135: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.help public void commandAction(Command command, Displayable displayable) ^ help.java:135: cannot find symbol symbol : class Displayable location: class jmbriscola.help public void commandAction(Command command, Displayable displayable) ^ help.java:177: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.help Command CmdExit; ^ help.java:178: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.help Command CmdPrevious; ^ help.java:179: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.help Command CmdNext; ^ help.java:180: cannot find symbol symbol : class ImageItem location: class jmbriscola.help ImageItem image_field; ^ help.java:181: cannot find symbol symbol : class StringItem location: class jmbriscola.help StringItem string_field; ^ help.java:182: cannot find symbol symbol : class StringItem location: class jmbriscola.help StringItem pag_field; ^ help_this_itemStateAdapter.java:8: package javax.microedition.lcdui does not exi st import javax.microedition.lcdui.Item; ^ help_this_itemStateAdapter.java:9: package javax.microedition.lcdui does not exi st import javax.microedition.lcdui.ItemStateListener; ^ help_this_itemStateAdapter.java:15: cannot find symbol symbol: class ItemStateListener implements ItemStateListener ^ help_this_itemStateAdapter.java:23: cannot find symbol symbol : class Item location: class jmbriscola.help_this_itemStateAdapter public void itemStateChanged(Item item1) ^ mainMIDlet.java:9: package javax.microedition.lcdui does not exist import javax.microedition.lcdui.*; ^ mainMIDlet.java:10: package javax.microedition.midlet does not exist import javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet; ^ mainMIDlet.java:11: package javax.microedition.rms does not exist import javax.microedition.rms.RecordStore; ^ mainMIDlet.java:12: package javax.microedition.rms does not exist import javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException; ^ mainMIDlet.java:18: cannot find symbol symbol: class MIDlet public class mainMIDlet extends MIDlet ^ mainMIDlet.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol: class CommandListener implements CommandListener ^ mainMIDlet.java:176: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.mainMIDlet public void commandAction(Command command1, Displayable displayable1) ^ mainMIDlet.java:176: cannot find symbol symbol : class Displayable location: class jmbriscola.mainMIDlet public void commandAction(Command command1, Displayable displayable1) ^ ragioniere.java:66: cannot find symbol symbol : method repaint() location: class jmbriscola.GUI mainMIDlet.instance.gameGUI.repaint(); ^ ragioniere.java:67: cannot find symbol symbol : method serviceRepaints() location: class jmbriscola.GUI mainMIDlet.instance.gameGUI.serviceRepaints(); ^ demo.java:20: cannot find symbol symbol : class Command location: class jmbriscola.demo CmdExit = new Command("Exit", 7, 2); ^ demo.java:21: cannot find symbol symbol : class StringItem location: class jmbriscola.demo stringItem = new StringItem("", ""); ^ demo.java:22: cannot find symbol symbol : class StringItem location: class jmbriscola.demo TextBox = new StringItem("", ""); ^ demo.java:49: cannot find symbol symbol : method setCommandListener(jmbriscola.demo) location: class jmbriscola.demo setCommandListener(this); ^ GUI.java:38: cannot find symbol symbol : class Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI CardsImages = new Image[40]; ^ GUI.java:79: cannot find symbol symbol : method isDoubleBuffered() location: class jmbriscola.GUI if(!isDoubleBuffered()) ^ GUI.java:80: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI offscreen = Image.createImage(MyWidth, MyHeight); ^ GUI.java:86: cannot find symbol symbol : method getWidth() location: class jmbriscola.GUI MyWidth = getWidth(); ^ GUI.java:89: cannot find symbol symbol : method getHeight() location: class jmbriscola.GUI MyHeight = getHeight() - ToolBarSize; ^ GUI.java:90: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Font location: class jmbriscola.GUI FontHeight = Font.getFont(0, 0, 0).getHeight(); ^ GUI.java:91: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Font location: class jmbriscola.GUI Font2Width = Font.getFont(0, 0, 0).stringWidth("00"); ^ GUI.java:98: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI ImageIntro = Image.createImage(generic_path + "/intro.png"); ^ GUI.java:99: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI ImageHand = Image.createImage(generic_path + "/hand.png"); ^ GUI.java:102: cannot find symbol symbol : method getHeight() location: class jmbriscola.GUI if(ImageIntro.getHeight() > getHeight() - 2 * FontHeight) ^ GUI.java:103: cannot find symbol symbol : method getHeight() location: class jmbriscola.GUI ImageIntro = resizeImage(ImageIntro, -1, getHeight() - 2 * FontHeigh t); ^ GUI.java:104: cannot find symbol symbol : method getWidth() location: class jmbriscola.GUI if(ImageIntro.getWidth() > getWidth()) ^ GUI.java:105: cannot find symbol symbol : method getWidth() location: class jmbriscola.GUI ImageIntro = resizeImage(ImageIntro, getWidth(), -1); ^ GUI.java:110: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Font location: class jmbriscola.GUI graphics.setFont(Font.getFont(0, 0, 0)); ^ GUI.java:143: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Display location: class jmbriscola.GUI Display.getDisplay(mainMIDlet.instance).setCurrent(mainMIDlet.instan ce.demo_frame); ^ GUI.java:153: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI Image_back = Image.createImage(cards_path + "/back.png"); ^ GUI.java:171: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI CardsImages[indice] = Image.createImage(cards_path + "/" + D ummyCard.GetShortColore() + v + ".png"); ^ GUI.java:175: cannot find symbol symbol : method repaint() location: class jmbriscola.GUI repaint(); ^ GUI.java:176: cannot find symbol symbol : method serviceRepaints() location: class jmbriscola.GUI serviceRepaints(); ^ GUI.java:228: cannot find symbol symbol : class Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI Image _tmp = image; ^ GUI.java:229: cannot find symbol symbol : class Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI Image newImage = Image.createRGBImage(new_png, newWidth, newHeight, true ); ^ GUI.java:229: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Image location: class jmbriscola.GUI Image newImage = Image.createRGBImage(new_png, newWidth, newHeight, true ); ^ GUI.java:243: cannot find symbol symbol : method getHeight() location: class jmbriscola.GUI g.fillRect(0, 0, W, getHeight() * 2); ^ GUI.java:259: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Font location: class jmbriscola.GUI g.setFont(Font.getFont(0, 1, 8)); ^ GUI.java:272: cannot find symbol symbol : method getWidth() location: class jmbriscola.GUI int W = getWidth(); ^ GUI.java:279: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp = g; ^ GUI.java:280: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp1 = g; ^ GUI.java:287: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp = graphics; ^ GUI.java:288: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp1 = graphics; ^ GUI.java:293: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp2 = graphics; ^ GUI.java:294: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp3 = graphics; ^ GUI.java:298: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp4 = graphics; ^ GUI.java:299: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp5 = graphics; ^ GUI.java:311: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Font location: class jmbriscola.GUI graphics.setFont(Font.getFont(0, 0, 8)); ^ GUI.java:312: cannot find symbol symbol : class Graphics location: class jmbriscola.GUI Graphics _tmp = graphics; ^ 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

In addition, it appears some of your classes are missing some import statements…notably in jmbriscola.GUI, import java.awt.*

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Myb he doesn’t understand the difference between the runtime environments, would explain why he is trying to recompile it and failing.

Myb I repped you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Thanks for the help im going to try it when i get back in a few minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It looks like you’re compiling a J2ME class with the J2SE compiler?

EDIT: Regecks is a 10000wpm whore.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

You have decompiled it. To recompile it, you need to have the J2ME JDK installed on your computer, and use its compiling capability to recompile the application.

http://java.sun.com

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Yes it is J2ME it is a ‘mobile java’ application.

So is there a way i can de-compile it without having to fix multiple errors? Or is it near impossible?

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Wrong answer.

Seems to be this seems to be a J2ME thing?

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Decompilers are far from perfect, especially if the code is obfuscated or compiled with a java version greater than 1.4, so you have to be prepared to fix a lot of things sometimes.

Read full topic
